comment: PROFESSOR IS VERY MONOTONED & DOESN'T REALLY TEACH. HE JUST GOES THROUGH A POWERPOINT EVERY LECTURE & THINKS THAT HE IS TEACHING. NEVER CURVED TEST, NO EXTRA CREDIT, AND OTHER CLASSES WERE ALLOWED TO HAVE A NOTECARD BUT WE DIDN'T. HE IS OLDER SO I FEEL LIKE HE STUCK IN OLD SCHOOL WAYS OF TEACHING BUT ITS 2025.... :( I WOULD TAKE SOMEBODY ELSE.

This class started out super rough and I was ready to write a really bad review. However, I think the starting content is just boring and hard because he got much better as time went on. He's good at lecturing and will answer any questions you have as long as you ask. Definitely use his office hours before a test and make flash cards.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Very hard teacher, if you value your sanity do not take him. There are no extra credit opportunities nor does he curve bad test grades!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Fair. Sometimes what he taught was different than what my lab prof taught. He explained more of the "what" and not the "why" or "how" which made it hard to apply information. He uses smart works which is great, but did not set it up to communicate with d2l. I missed many assignments which dropped me a letter grade. These make up 20pts/100pts total.

P-chem is a complex course, and I understand his difficulties of teaching it to an extent. However, the bigger problem than his roundabout lectures is that he is rude. Gets visibly annoyed at incorrect answers over content he fails to properly cover. Stumbles over disordered materials. Fine as an individual, I'm sure. Not as a professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Mitchell is very good at Physical Chemistry, but not the best at teaching it. I enjoyed his class and would take him again. Be advised that you will be learning this material outside of class time. You have to get used to solving these types of problems and he rarely does examples in class. Do office hours. He'll show how to do them there.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a knowledgeable professor, but the content itself sometimes can be confusing. Exams were difficult but he explains which topics/chapters we specifically need to study. Just make sure to study and understand. Also ask questions too.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: 3 exams and cumulative final. All exams contain a plethora of info; study up! All exams have bonus points built in; it's possible to get over a 100%. We had a couple quizzes, some homeworks, and some reading notes, but not much. Pretty low maintenance class, just be prepared for the exams. He's always willing to help over call or in office! Take!

Dr. Mitchell gives a fair amount of online homework but it is very and relevant! always willing to help and explain things during class or through email. Tests were hard but he emphasizes which topics to review, study and use the extra resources he gives! They are helpful!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: He is a very good professor I can tell that he's passionate about what he teaches and wants to make sure you learn, but his lectures can get kinda boring and his dates for assignments are a little weird, but if you stay up to date on those and do work outside of class to make sure you understand then your set. He is also very easy to talk to.

I failed the class but that was my bad. If I tried more Im sure I wouldve passed. Just make sure you study the learning objectives and understand them all and youll pass. Oh and always do his worksheets and bring them with you to class. If you understand the hw, quotes and learning objectives, youll pass... idk about an A tho.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He's a great person, but not the best instructor. He's very intelligent, and I felt like i was being left behind. I didn't have a textbook so that may have helped. Classes get very boring because he lectures the whole time
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Hes very kind. Hes very smart but he doesnt know how to really teach what he knows. Make sure to read and stay on top of lectures and notes. Ask questions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He does mess up on some of the examples he uses, and he is a tad bit unorganized with the lecture, but he lets everyone know that you can come by and ask him for help. HE IS WILLING TO HELP YOU. The tests are fairly easy. About 15 MC questions maybe with two short FRE's and there are always bonus questions worth up to, at most, 15 pts!

He is a very smart man, he just struggles o pass on his knowledge to other students. What bothered me was he never finished a problem on the board we were doing. He would ask the fromt row if they got it (which they always did) and he would just erase the whole thing, wouldn't even ask anyone else. He's very frustrating to learn from.
